channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm worried that my 6K target is too low,‚Äô Goldman Sachs strategist says on S&P 500 target
item.description: Goldman Sachs technical strategist Scott Rubner said he expects a major rally in the S&P 500 index could push it over 6,000 points

item.title: Ford's third-quarter sales up 0.7% as GM overtakes it in EVs
item.description: Ford on Wednesday reported a 0.7% increase in third-quarter U.S. new vehicle sales, including a 12.2% increase in EVs compared to a year earlier.

item.title: Goldman-backed Starling Bank fined $38.5 million for 'shockingly lax' financial crime controls
item.description: London's Financial Conduct Authority said it has fined Starling "for financial crime failings related to its financial sanctions screening."

item.title: LPL fires CEO for allegedly breaking respectful-workplace rules
item.description: LPL Financial Holdings Inc.‚Äôs stock opened lower Wednesday after the company said it fired Dan H. Arnold as CEO for allegedly violating the financial advice firm‚Äôs rules on a respectful workplace.

item.title: Tesla stock slips after EV maker misses estimates on deliveries
item.description: Tesla's third-quarter deliveries report follows a rally in the stock price over the past few months.

item.title: Nike ‚Äòstill not out of the woods,‚Äô analyst says, as stock drops after earnings
item.description: Nike Inc.‚Äôs stock fell 8% on Wednesday after the athletic-apparel company‚Äôs latest quarterly results disappointed investors.

item.title: Stellantis U.S. auto sales extend free fall in third quarter
item.description: Stellantis reported U.S. sales Tuesday of 305,294 from July through September, a 19.8% decline from the third quarter of 2023.

item.title: VP debate recap: Vance, Walz clash over abortion and immigration, but find common ground on housing
item.description: Sen. JD Vance, the Republican vice presidential nominee, and Democratic pick Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota debated Tuesday night in New York City.

item.title: ‚ÄòI feel like I‚Äôm missing something‚Äô: I‚Äôm 68, divorced with two children. I‚Äôve $750,000 and rent my home. Do I need a trust?
item.description: ‚ÄúI continue to reinvest the dividends and interest so my investments continue to grow.‚Äù

item.title: Private payrolls show better-than-expected growth of 143,000 in September, ADP says
item.description: Companies added 143,000 for the month, an acceleration from 103,000 in August and better than the 128,000 consensus forecast

item.title: Bitcoin tumbles back to the $60,000 level as tensions in the Middle East rise
item.description: Bitcoin has had a shaky start to what is usually one of its strongest months, sliding back to $60,000.

item.title: Humana‚Äôs stock rocked after a Medicare Advantage plan‚Äôs rating is set to drop
item.description: Humana‚Äôs stock was headed for another sharp selloff on Tuesday, toward a more than four-year low, after the government cut its rating on one of the health insurer‚Äôs large Medicare Advantage plans because it missed some performance measures.

item.title: Eli Lilly to build $4.5 billion research and manufacturing center to propel drug pipeline
item.description: Lilly has 11 obesity drugs in its pipeline and wants to develop more treatments for Alzheimer's disease, ALS and other brain diseases, CEO David Ricks said.

item.title: Oil watchers now see a real threat of supply disruptions after latest Iran-Israel escalation
item.description: Oil watchers are now factoring in a genuine threat to crude supplies after Iran launched a barrage of missiles on Israel.
